metadata.synopsis: Upon our learning of Stelmane’s murder, we stumble on the Emperor in a dream, reflecting nostalgically on its past life with Stelmane and all that it hopes to reclaim (all part of the mind flayer manipulation).
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to Act 3 (BGO)Queue Campnight NIGHT_DaisyStelmaneEnd the Day and Go to Bed

21.text: How did you - oh. It's you. I must have let my mind wander. Enough for you to wander in.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the dream field. Shot of the Emperor is sitting with its back to you on a bench, alone, looking unusually pensive and morose against the backdrop of the astral plane - the globe of domination visible in the distance. All is quiet now in contrast to the battles we previously saw here. The player approaches.

96.text: How did you - oh. It's you. I must have let my mind wander. Enough for you to wander in.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player wakes up in the dream field. Shot of the Emperor is sitting with its back to you on a bench, alone, looking unusually pensive and morose against the backdrop of the astral plane - the globe of domination visible in the distance. All is quiet now in contrast to the battles we previously saw here. The player approaches. The Emperor notices us with a start - they weren't expecting us.NodeContext: Emperor startled by player, looks behind to his right, before looking back infront

72.text: Forgive me. I am drained. Ever since you killed Ketheric and took his Netherstone, the Chosen's control of the brain has been... brittle.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

58.text: Its rebellion against Orin and Gortash has been fierce. Even as it executes their final orders.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

34.text: Once those orders are complete, there is a good chance it will break free.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You feel the Emperor's fear as if it were your own. An elder brain enslaved is one thing, an elder brain unleashed will be the end of everything.*
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

61.text: Beautiful, isn't it? The mighty Prince Orpheus, contained in submissive slumber.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer shot of globe of domination and skull vista. NodeContext: Emperor looking in front

63.text: Come, you may as well sit a while, now that you're here.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor sat on bench. Player stood next to him. Shot from behind of the two them looking out at the view together.

53.text: Come, you may as well sit a while, now that you're here.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor pats the spot on the bench next to him. Player sits beside Emperor. NodeContext: Emperor looks to his right at player

76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Awkward silence before the Emperor speaks.

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Awkward silence before the Emperor speaks.

12.text: Trying to guard us. The brain is restless. But I'm distracted, and my lack of focus is endangering us.

55.text: An accurate summary. I have found myself distracted of late.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I expected you to be more on guard this close to the brain.

106.text: You are correct. I should be.

4.text: We are more alike than you would like to acknowledge. I am merely further along in my evolution than you.

5.text: I understand my outer membrane and appendages unnerve you. But despite my exterior, I still feel.

97.text: I'm haunted by memories. They are relentless. I can think of nothing - no one - else.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Belynne, is it? The duke that's dead?

82.text: The very same. Duke Stelmane, as she was known in Baldur's Gate.

109.text: Duke Stelmane. Or Belynne, as I knew her. I wasn't ready for her death.

87.text: Indeed. Duke Stelmane. Or as I knew her - Belynne. When she was alive.

85.text: Not love, no. What I had with Belynne Stelmane was much more than that. It was - unique.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: The past is past. Move on.

0.text: You are impatient. Even in this, you remind me of her, of Belynne Stelmane.

67.text: At least - when she was alive.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts with surprise at the longing in the Emperor's voice when it talks of Stelmane. Emperor clocks our surprise.

70.text: You thought you were my first ally?
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts with surprise at the longing in the Emperor's voice when it talks of Stelmane. Emperor clocks our surprise.

39.text: Far from it. I have long sought the allyship of others - it is the only way to succeed.

94.text: Though my relationship with Belynne was - different, from my relationship with you.

88.text: In a way. But not the way you're thinking of.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Did you manipulate her like you manipulated me?

65.text: I see you are unable to let that go. But do not forget that I trusted you with my life, as you trusted me with yours.

84.text: Manipulation or not, we need each other. My relationship with Belynne was similar in this regard. Though - less dramatic.

35.text: In life, she was my business partner. Back when we ran the Knights of the Shield. A difficult task, for a mind flayer.

104.text: Duke Stelmane trusted me, and the city trusted her. I conceived the plot, but Belynne took centre-stage.

66.text: It was she who met with the merchants, politicians, patriars. It was she who negotiated deals and signed off on agreements. Her rooms played host to the most important conversations in the city.

103.text: Together, we brought order to chaos. At its height, everything that happened in that city went through the Shield. Through us.
103.context: NodeContext: voice slightly breaking, as if on the verge of tears

27.text: I could not have done any of it without her. Just as I cannot do any of this without you. But now she's gone.
27.context: NodeContext: voice slightly breaking, as if on the verge of tears

20.speaker: Player
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

17.text: I appreciate the offer, but I don't think it will help.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

81.text: What I feel is deeper than superficial cures can reach. And not entirely unwelcome.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

23.text: Most people think that mind flayers are soulless husks who feel nothing. I am glad you are not most people.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Give the Emperor's hand a reassuring squeeze.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

10.text: You have shown me great empathy. We are closer now, close enough - I hope - that I can ask you to reconsider your position regarding your physical form.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player gives the Emperor's hand a squeeze with a look of ecnouragement. The mind flayer gives a look of gratitude.

73.text: You have shown me great empathy. We are closer now, close enough - I hope - that I can ask you to reconsider your position regarding your physical form.

2.text: You have shown me great empathy. We are closer now, close enough - I hope - that I can ask you to reconsider your position regarding your physical form.
2.context: NodeContext: Player is on Emperor's right

51.text: I know it is no easy choice for you, but we will have a far better time ridding the city of Gortash if you accept just a touch of illithidness.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

68.text: Not to mention the elder brain itself. Our chances against it greatly improve the more illithid we both are.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

44.text: Another quake. The brain is rebelling again. I need to focus. And so do you.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

89.speaker: Player
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: The emperor gives a sage, knowing nod.

16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The emperor gives a sage, knowing nod.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: If I didn't know you were a mind flayer, I'd say you were upset.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Drop the act. I know you don't have feelings.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Watching your loves die only makes you tougher.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

47.text: You are weaker than I imagined, if you lie to yourself so.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

107.text: You think that mind flayers are soulless husks who feel nothing. Belynne thought the same at first.
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gives mind flayer a skeptical look.

105.text: You are wrong. Feeling is vital to the pursuit of anyone's goals. Even a mind flayer's.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

49.text: Like you, mind flayers know fear. Like you, we crave recognition.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

19.text: But unlike you, unlike the others of my kind, I am no slave to either.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

25.text: My end is and has always been freedom.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

37.text: Belynne understood this. Belynne became my freedom.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Don't let your guard down again.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

69.text: But I could do with your assistance. You remain attached to your physical form. I suggest you shed that attachment.

38.text: We will do better against the elder brain the more illithid we both are.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I know you're trying to manipulate me. It's not working. I know what you are.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

62.text: You would do well to be more like me. Your humanoid tendencies are becoming an encumbrance. Leave me.

32.text: You would do well to be more like me. Now leave.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Sorry I was mean to you.
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

100.text: Another quake. The brain is rebelling again. I need to focus.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quake. The Emperor pulls itself together and straightens to its full height, back in business. The player stands also. NodeContext: Emperor stands up and look around at the furniture disappearing around him. Calm & collected

41.text: I am glad you were able to learn something.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I really don't care what your relationship with her was like.

6.text: And yet you emulate it so well.

30.text: Very well. Then let us move on.

3.text: You remain very attached to your physical form. I suggest you shed it.

52.text: I need to focus. The brain is rebelling again. Be on your way and leave me to my thoughts.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I just want a dreamless sleep for once.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's eyes fall shut. Fade to black.

110.text: I apologise. I didn't mean to burden you with my woes. You have enough to worry about.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's eyes fall shut. Fade to black.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *As your eyes blink shut, you fall into the deepest slumber of your life. A quietness so vast it feels almost like death.*
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's eyes fall shut. Fade to black.

111.text: It's rebelling against Orin and Gortash. Fiercely.

80.text: I suspected that when we took Ketheric's stone, the brain would begin to break free. Those brainquakes confirm that my suspicion was correct.

83.text: I do not know what happens now when it receives their orders, and I do not dare guess.
